column4: Might there be a manual way to get flash onto my ubuntu-ness?
the package is not working?
Here's what happens, I'll do it right now so I can tell you exactly
I'm going to follow www.ubuntuguide.org instructions
now I'm selecting yes telling it I want it to download the package from the Internet
Now, " Setting up flashplugin-nonfree (7.0.63.3ubuntu3) ..."  This is where it typically dies
waiting......
so does it eventually tell you it can't download the file?
typically, it just does nothing
Actually I've never had it tell me it can't download the file
Jrib:  but I've figured that is the problem
ok, download the file manually and put it on your desktop
the .tar.gz file, right?
right
okay, one second....
okay, done
sudo update-flashplugin -l ~/Desktop
oh, nice!
Thanks man!
I'm going to restart moz, and see what happens, thanks for the help though-- last step to a perfect PC :)
np, remember it never hurts to check the man pages even though I'll admit they are hard to read through sometimes
Packages have man pages, or.... how would I do that in this context?  Typically, I know how to do that, but would it just be.... man update-flashplugin?
yep, man update-flashplugin is what let me know about that -l switch
